Module promethium.lang
Package io.github.epi155.pm.lang

Interface Nope

All Superinterfaces:
AnyError, Glitch, ItemStatus, OnlyError, SingleError
public interface Nope extends SingleError, OnlyError
Utility class for carrying a single error

The interface has static constructors with custom error message or without 

      Nope.nope();                                    // no error
      Nope.failure(CustMsg ce, Object... argv);       // error message
and with Exception 
      Nope.capture(Throwable t);      // error from Exception (package level)
      Nope.captureHere(Throwable t);  // error from Exception (method level)

The outcome of the interface can be evaluated imperatively 

      if (nope.completeWithoutErrors()) {
          // ... action on success
      } else {
          val fault = nope.fault();
          // ... action on error
      }
or functionally 
      nope
          .onSuccess(() -> { ... })    // ... action on success
          .onFailure(e -> { ... });    // ... action on error

      R r = nope.<R>mapTo(
          () -> ...R,     // supplier to R
          e -> ...R);     // function from error to R

    • capture

      @NotNull static @NotNull Nope capture(@NotNull @NotNull Throwable t)
      Create an error Nope

      The first class / method / line of the stacktrace, which has the same package as the class it calls capture (limited to the first two namespaces), is identified as a detail of the error

      Parameters:
      t - exception to catch
      Returns:
      instance of PmNope with error

    • captureHere

      @NotNull static @NotNull Nope captureHere(@NotNull @NotNull Throwable t)
      Create an error Nope

      The method / line of the stacktrace, which threw the class-internal exception calling capture , is identified as a detail of the error

      Parameters:
      t - exception to catch
      Returns:
      instance of PmNope with error

    • onSuccess

      @NotNull @NotNull Glitch onSuccess(Runnable action)
      Set the action on success

      In the event of an error, the action is not performed.

      Parameters:
      action - action to be taken if successful
      Returns:
      Glitch to set the action on failure
      See Also:
      • Glitch.onFailure(Consumer)

    • orThrow

      void orThrow() throws FailureException
      If there is an error throw an exception
      Throws:
      FailureException - exception with error payload

    • ergo

      @NotNull @NotNull Nope ergo(@NotNull @NotNull Supplier<? extends SingleError> fcn)
      If there is no error, the supplier is called, if this ends with an error, this error is returned. In the presence of an error, the supplier is not called, and the initial error is returned
      Parameters:
      fcn - producer Hope or Nope
      Returns:
      Nope instance, if this has an error, the producer is not called and the result has the original error

    • map

      @NotNull <R> @NotNull Hope<R> map(@NotNull @NotNull Supplier<Hope<R>> fcn)
      If there are no errors, the supplier is called, if this ends with errors, these errors are returned. In the presence of errors, the supplier is not called, and the initial errors are returned

      The method allows to compose the Nope with a Hope. Using an imperative outcome evaluation we would have 

            Nope na = compute();
      Hope<B> sb;
      if (na.completeWithoutErrors()) {
          sb = n2sb();    // Hope<B> n2sb()
      } else {
          sb = Hope.failure(na);
      }
      The method simplifies it to 
            Hope<B> kb = compute().<B>map(this::n2sb);
      Type Parameters:
      R - Hope type
      Parameters:
      fcn - producer Hope
      Returns:
      Hope instance

    • peek

      @NotNull @NotNull Nope peek(@NotNull @NotNull Runnable action)
      If there is no error, the action is performed. In any case, the initial error is returned.
      Parameters:
      action - action executed if there are no errors
      Returns:
      Nope instance, with original error, if any

    • mapTo

      <R> R mapTo(Supplier<R> onSuccess, Function<Failure,R> onFailure)
      constructs a result using two alternative methods depending on whether the operation completed successfully or failed
      Type Parameters:
      R - result type
      Parameters:
      onSuccess - success builder
      onFailure - failure builder
      Returns:
      result
